ingredients: 2 teaspoons sea salt | 2 teaspoons vinegar | 6 eggs | rice, for serving | dried seaweed, for garnish | ½ cup soy sauce | ½ cup water | ¼ cup honey | ¼ cup diced onion | 2 red chilis, sliced | 1 green onion, diced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon sesame seeds | 2 lemon slices, cut in quarters

ingredients: 4 lb shrimp, cleaned deveined | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 5 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated | 2 teaspoons onion powder | 1 tablespoon all-purpose seafood seasoning | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 cup flour | 2 eggs, beated | 2 cups panko breadcrumbs | sesame seed, for garnish | scallion stalk, chopped, for garnish | 48 fl oz vegetable oil, for frying | 1 cup kewpie mayonnaise | ½ cup sweet chili sauce | 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce | 1 lime, juiced

ingredients: 5 strands saffron | 2 teaspoons warm water | 8 oz mascarpone cheese, room temperature | ½ cup greek yogurt | ¾ cup mango pulp, chilled | 1.25 cups heavy whipping cream, chilled | 5 tablespoons powdered sugar | 1.5 teaspoons cardamom powder | 2 cups Chai with coconut milk | 1 (13.25-ounce) package ladyfingers | 3 mangoes, peeled and sliced, for garnish | crushed freeze-dried mango, for garnish (optional) | mint, for garnish (optional) | rose bud, for garnish (optional) | shredded coconut, for garnish

Spread the remaining mascarpone mixture over the second layer of ladyfingers. | Cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld. | Before serving, dust with the crushed freeze-dried mango and top with fresh mango slices. ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 small yellow onion, finely chopped | 2 garlic cloves, minced | 2 tablespoons tomato paste | 1 red bell pepper, finely chopped | 1 (14-ounce) can diced tomatoes, or 2 cups fresh peeled tomatoes | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon red chili flakes | ¼ teaspoon chili powder | 2 teaspoons garlic powder | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | salt and pepper, to taste | 4 large eggs | ¼ cup crumbled feta cheese | fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish | crusty bread, for serving
directions: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic.  Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes. | Add in the diced red peppers, tomato paste, cumin, chili powder, paprika, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt and pepperCook for another minute until fragrant. | Pour in the diced tomatoes andfish sauce.. ingredients: 1 cup red dragon fruit, peeled and chopped | 1 tablespoon granulated sugar | 1 tablespoon lemon juice | 1 cup water, divided | 3 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatins | 1.5 cups granulated sugar | 1 cup light corn syrup | confectioners' sugar, for dusting
directions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine diced dragon fruit, granulated sugar, and lemon juice. Stir until sugar is dissolved. When the mixture boils, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thickened and jammy. | Pour compote into a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Then set aside to cool. | Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. | In the bowl of a stand mixer, stir together dragon fruit compote and 1⁄2 cup cold water. Sprinkle gelatin on top and let it bloom for 5 minutes until gelatin is dissolved. | In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine granulated sugar, corn syrup and remaining ½ cup water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring the mixture to a boil, swirling the pan occasionally, until the mixture reaches exactly 240°F (115°C) on a candy thermometer, about 10-12 minutes. Immediately remove from heat. | With the stand mixer on low speed, slowly pour the melted sugar mixture into the gelatin mixture. Slowly, increase the speed to high and whip until the mixture is stiff and light pink, about 7 to 10 minutes. When you remove the whisk, stiff peaks should form. Working quickly, pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan and use a spatula to spread evenly. | Let the marshmallows sit for at least 4 hours at room temperature until firm. | Sprinkle your work surface with confectioner's sugar. Use a butter knife to slice around the edges of the pan, then turn the marshmallow out onto the work surface. Use a sharp knife to cut the marshmallow into 12 squares. If needed, spray the knife with cooking spray to help prevent sticking. | Toss each marshmallow in confectioner's sugar on each side to prevent sticking, then serve and enjoy! | Love this recipe? recipe_name: Air Fryer Mango Thai Chicken Wings
ingredients: 1.5 lb chicken wings | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon baking powder | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon onion powder | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 2 large mangoes, peeled, pitted, and coarsely chopped | 10 red thai chiles | ½ cup water | 2 garlic cloves | 4 tablespoons honey | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold | scallion, sliced, for garnish | red thai chile, minced, for garnish | fresh lime juice, for garnish

Set aside. | Preheat an air fryer to 400°F (200°C) for 5 minutes. | In the air fryer basket, arrange the chicken wings in a single layer. | Air fry the chicken wings for 10 minutes. Flip the chicken wings and continue air frying for 8 minutes, or until the skin is golden brown and crispy. | Transfer the cooked wings to a bowl and toss with mango sauce. | Add to a serving plate and garnish with scallions, fresh chiles and a squeeze of lime juice. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. ingredients: 4 oz cream cheese, room temperature | 4 Thomas’® Everything Bagels, toasted and halved | 2 cups arugula | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 4 large eggs | salt, to taste | freshly ground black pepper, to taste | 5 jarred roasted red peppers | ½ cup olive oil | ½ cup toasted blanched almonds | ⅓ cup fire-roasted canned tomatoes | ¼ cup fresh parsley leaves | ¼ cup toasted blanched hazelnuts | ½ lemon, juiced | 2 garlic cloves, peeled | 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar | 1 teaspoon salt | ½ teaspoon smoked paprika | ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes
directions: Make the sandwiches: Spread the cream cheese evenly onto the bottom half of each toasted Thomas’® Everything Bagel, then top with the arugula. | Make the romesco sauce: In a blender, combine the red bell peppers, olive oil, almonds, tomatoes, parsley, hazelnuts, lemon juice, garlic, vinegar, salt, smoked paprika, and red pepper flakes. Fry the eggs for 6-7 minutes, until whites are cooked through and yolks are still runny. Season with salt and black pepper. | Place a fried egg on top of the arugula for each sandwich. Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the romesco sauce over each fried egg. Cover with the top half of each toasted Thomas’® Everything Bagel. | Enjoy!

ingredients: unsalted butter, for greasing | 2 Thomas’® Plain Bagels, cut into ½-inch cubes | 2 large peaches, cut into ½-inch cubes | 1.25 cups half-and-half | 4 large eggs | ½ cup sugar | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 teaspoon cinnamon | ½ teaspoon nutmeg | powdered sugar, for garnish

Divide evenly amongst the 4 ramekins, then press the bread pudding down so the liquid is absorbed properly. | Place the filled ramekins onto a sheet tray and let chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. | Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). | Bake the bread puddings on the sheet tray for 25-30 minutes, until the tops are golden brown and spring back when lightly pressed. Allow to cool for 10 minutes. | Dust the tops with powdered sugar, and enjoy warm!

ingredients: 1 cup warm milk, (115°F) | ⅕ teaspoon instant dry yeast | 2 large eggs, room temperature | ½ cup salted butter, room temperature | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon cinnamon | ½ cup cane sugar | 4 cups all-purpose flour | 4 peaches, diced | ¼ cup dark brown sugar, + 2 tbsp | 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon | 1 teaspoon vanilla paste | 1 teaspoon cornstarch, + 2 tsp water | ½ lemon, juiced | ¾ cup salted butter, melted and cooled | ⅕ cup dark brown sugar | 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon | 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg | ½ cup heavy cream, to top off rolls before baking | ½ cup salted butter, melted | ⅔ cup dark brown sugar | 1 cup all-purpose flour, + 2 tbsp | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon | ¹⁄₁₆ teaspoon kosher salt | 8 oz cream cheese, softened | ½ cup salted butter, room temperature | 2 cups powdered sugar | 1 teaspoon vanilla | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
directions: Make the Dough: Add warm milk and yeast to a stand mixer bowl. | Add eggs, softened butter, salt, cinnamon, and cane sugar to the mixture and mix until evenly combined. | Add the flour and mix until combined using the paddle attachment for 1-2 minutes. Let the dough rest for about 5 minutes. | Attach the dough hook and mix for about 5 minutes on setting 1. The dough should be slightly sticky; if too sticky, add flour a tablespoon at a time, no more than 3 tbsp. | Grease a large mixing bowl with butter, transfer the dough to the greased bowl, cover, and let it double in size, about 45-60 minutes in a warm kitchen. | Prepare the Peach Filling: In a saucepan, combine diced peaches, brown sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes until bubbly. | Mix cornstarch and water, stir into the peach mixture, and cook for 1 minute until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in vanilla paste, and chill. Reserve ½ cup for topping. | Make the Filling: In a bowl, mix cooled melted butter, brown sugar, nutmeg, and cinnamon until well combined. Set aside. | Assemble the Rolls: After the dough has doubled in size, sprinkle flour on a clean surface and roll out the dough to about 12x24 inches. | Spread the butter-cinnamon mixture evenly over the dough using a rubber spatula. Add dollops of peach topping, reserving ½ cup for the final topping. | Slice strips from the long side of the dough that are about 1 ¾-inches thick. Roll each strip into a roll and place in a greased 12x16 baking pan. Let the rolls rise again for about 35 minutes until doubled in size. | Prepare the Cinnamon Streusel: Combine melted butter, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Spread on a parchment-lined tray and bake at 350°F for 8 minutes. Let cool. | Bake the Rolls: Pour heavy cream over the risen rolls, ensuring it seeps between them for moisture. Sprinkle a tablespoon of the streusel over the rolls, reserving the rest for topping. | Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, checking to ensure the center and sides are cooked. | Prepare the Frosting: In a stand mixer, beat cream cheese and softened butter until smooth. | Gradually add powdered sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, and mix until well combined. For a glaze-like consistency, add 2 tablespoons of milk and mix well. Set aside. | Once baked, frost the warm rolls with the prepared cream cheese frosting. | Top each roll with the reserved chilled peach filling and a sprinkle of the remaining streusel. | Store in an airtight container in the fridge for 2-3 days. Reheat gently before serving. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: ¼ cup water | 1 cup granulated sugar | ½ cup peach nectar | 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold | 1 teaspoon kosher salt

Stir in the salt and continue cooking until the caramel thickens and reaches 235°F (113°C), about 2 minutes. | Remove caramel from the heat and allow it to slightly cool down before using. ingredients: 3 heads of garlic | ¾ cup pine nuts, toasted | 5 cups fresh basil leaves, packed | 2 cups grated parmesan cheese | 1 cup extra virgin olive oil, +1 tablespoon, divided | 1 lemon, juiced | 4 garlic cloves, grated | 2 teaspoons salt

ingredients: 1 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatin | 2 tablespoons cold water | 1 cup boiling water | ½ (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk | 1 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatin | 2 tablespoons cold water | 2 tablespoons instant coffee | 1.5 cups boiling water | ¼ cup granulated sugar | caramel sauce, for garnish | chocolate sprinkle, for garnish | silicone donut pan

ingredients: 3 lb chuck roast | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 6 garlic cloves, minced | 4 roma tomatoes, chopped | 2 tablespoons canned chipotle pepper | ½ large yellow onion, thinly sliced | 10 dried guajillo chiles, seeds and stems removed | 5 arbol chiles | 6 cups beef broth, plus more for braising, if needed | 5 large bay leaves | 2 tablespoons beef bouillon | 3 tablespoons chili powder | ½ tablespoon smoked paprika | 2 teaspoons dried thyme | 1.5 tablespoons ground cumin | 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 1 tablespoon mexican oregano | 1 cinnamon stick | sourdough bread, sliced | cheddar cheese, sliced | shredded oaxaca cheese | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, for grilled cheese | ½ yellow onion, diced, for sandwich | cilantro, roughly chopped

Stir. | Cover and simmer on low heat for 2 hours, until meat is falling apart. Remove the meat and vegetables, leaving the broth in the pot. Blend vegetables, then stir back into the broth. ingredients: 2 cups whole milk, warm to the touch | ½ cup sugar | 8 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted | 2.25 teaspoons active dry yeast | 5 cups all-purpose flour, divided | 1 teaspoon baking powder | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 2 cups blueberries | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 tablespoons water | 1 tablespoon cornstarch | 2 teaspoons lavender extract | 4 oz cream cheese, softened and cubed | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted | 4 tablespoons milk | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 cup powdered sugar
directions: Make the dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the warm milk, sugar, and melted butter. The mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚F (37-43˚C). If any warmer, allow to cool slightly. | Sprinkle the yeast evenly over the milk mixture, stir, and let sit in a warm place for about 10 minutes until the yeast has bloomed. | Add 4 cups (500 g) of flour to the milk mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until just combined. | Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, until nearly doubled in size. | Generously butter one 9-inch (23 cm) round baking pan and set aside. | Make the Compote: place all of the compote ingredients into a medium sized pot on medium heat. Stir to combine and let the mixture simmer for 10-15 minutes. Once the blueberries burst the mixture will thicken, stir and then remove from the heat. Set aside to cool. | Remove the plastic wrap from the dough and add the remaining cup of flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir well, then turn out onto a clean surface. Leave a bit of flour nearby to use as needed, but try not to incorporate too much. | Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes, adding more flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface or your hands. The dough should be very smooth and spring back when poked. | Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix the corners with a bench scraper or a spatula to make sure they are sharp and even. | Spread the cooled compote evenly over the dough. | Starting from one short end, roll up the dough into a log and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down. Trim any uneven ends. | Using a serrated knife, cut the log into evenly sized pieces, about 2-inches thick. Place the rolls in the prepared pan, 1 in the center and about 6 around the sides. Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 35-45 minutes, until expanded by about half of their original volume. If you’re saving the rolls for later, cover with plastic wrap and freeze for up to 3 months. | Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C). | Bake the rolls for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown. | Make the frosting: In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, melted butter, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth. Gradually add the powdered sugar and whisk until homogenous and runny. | When the rolls are finished, let cool for about 10 minutes. | Drizzle the frosting over the rolls, using the back of a spoon to spread if desired. Swirl in some blueberry compote for additional color. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, shelled and deveined, tails left on | ½ teaspoon salt, plus more to taste | ¼ cup unsalted butter | ½ cup olive oil | 6 large garlic cloves, peeled and thinly sliced | ½ tablespoon McCormick® Crushed Jalapeño Pepper | 2 tablespoons dry white wine | ¼ tablespoon McCormick® Paprika | ½ teaspoon McCormick® Pure Ground Black Pepper | 1 teaspoon lemon zest, finely grated, plus more for garnish | ½ teaspoon lemon juice | lemon wheel, for serving | crusty bread, for serving

Taste and add more salt if need be. | Serve shrimp covered in sauce, garnished with more lemon zest, alongside crusty bread and lemon wheels. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour | 1 cup cornmeal | ⅓ cup brown sugar | 2 teaspoons baking powder | ½ teaspoon baking soda | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 1 tablespoon McCormick® Taco Seasoning | 2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese | ¼ cup unsalted butter, melted, divided | 1.33 cups buttermilk | ½ cup neutral oil | 3 large eggs | 1 (7-ounce) can diced green chilies, drained | 1 cup corn, (fresh, canned and drained or frozen and thawed) | ½ lb thick bacon, chopped | 1 small yellow onion, diced | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 3 tablespoons McCormick® Taco Seasoning | 1 (15-ounce) can cannellini beans, drained | 1 (15-ounce) can kidney bean, drained | 1 (15-ounce) can pinto beans | ½ cup barbecue sauce | ¾ cup tomato sauce | ¼ cup ketchup | 2 tablespoons yellow mustard | 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce | 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar | ½ teaspoon salt, more to taste | 1 teaspoon McCormick® Freeze Dried Chives
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. | For the cornbread: Whisk together flour, cornmeal, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt and 1 tablespoon McCormick® Taco Seasoning in a medium bowl. Stir in 1½ cups of the shredded cheddar until combined. | Whisk together buttermilk, oil, eggs, and 3 tablespoons melted butter in a separate medium bowl. Then mix in green chilies and corn. Set aside, leaving the cornbread in the pan, until the beans are ready. | While the cornbread bakes, make the cowboy beans. Add chopped bacon to a medium pot or Dutch oven over medium high heat and cook until bacon is crispy and browned, about 10 minutes. | Add the onion to the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes, until soft and golden brown. Add the garlic and McCormick® Taco Seasoning, then cook for another minute until fragrant. Mix in the beans. | Stir in barbeque sauce, tomato sauce, ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and apple cider vinegar. Add salt, then taste and add more if needed. | Bring to a simmer and then cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the beans are soft and the mixture has thickened slightly. If the mixture has not thickened enough, cook uncovered for a few minutes. Taste and add salt if needed. | Spoon cowboy beans into a bowl, top with McCormick® Freeze Dried Chives, and serve with a slice of the cornbread. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 cup cooked chicken, shredded or chopped | ½ teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon salt-free garlic seasoning | 1 egg | ½ cup romaine lettuce, roughly chopped | 4 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese | 1 slice turkey bacon, chopped | ¼ avocado, sliced | ¼ tomato, sliced | 1 teaspoon anchovy paste | 1 small garlic clove, minced | 1 tablespoon lemon juice, freshly squeezed | 1 teaspoon dijon mustard | 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce | ½ cup mayonnaise | ½ cup freshly grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon water | salt, to taste

ingredients: ½ shallot, finely diced | 1 cup mayonnaise | 2 tablespoons capers | ⅓ cup dill pickle, finely diced | zest of 1 lemon, and 1/2 juiced | 3 tablespoons dill, chopped | 3 tablespoons chives, chopped | salt and pepper, to taste | 3 cod fillets | 1 teaspoon salt | 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 2 teaspoons Old Bay® seasoning | 2 eggs, beaten | 1.5 cups all purpose flour | 2 teaspoons smoked paprika | 2 teaspoons garlic powder | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 cups panko breadcrumbs | neutral oil, for frying | american cheese, sliced | brioche  bun | dill pickle chip | ½ cup frying oil | 3 tablespoons light brown sugar | 2 tablespoons cayenne pepper | 2 teaspoons chili powder | 2 tablespoons smoked paprika | 1 teaspoon garlic powder
directions: For the tartar sauce, mix all ingredients together in a bowl until well combined. Refrigerate until ready to use. | Cut cod filets into pieces just a little larger than the buns. Season with salt, pepper, and Old Bay seasoning. | In a bowl, mix the flour with the smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. In another bowl, add the whisked eggs. In a third bowl, add the bread crumbs. Dredge fish in seasoned flour, then dip in the whisked eggs, and then coat in the bread crumbs evenly. | Fill a pot halfway with oil on medium heat until it reaches 350ºF. Fry the fish for 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. | To make the Nashville sauce, in a small bowl combine all the spices and half a cup of the hot oil and mix well. | Carefully dip the crispy cod in the Nashville sauce. | Toast buns and top the bottom with an American cheese slice and place the hot fish on top of the cheese. Add pickles and tartar sauce before adding the top bun. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1.5 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined | 2 lemons, juiced | 10 limes, juiced | 1 persian cucumber, diced | 4 roma tomatoes, diced | 1 small red onion, thinly sliced | 2 serrano peppers, thinly sliced | ⅓ cup cilantro, chopped | ½ cup clamato tomato juice | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | 1 small watermelon, cut into a rectangular shape | salt, to taste | 1 avocado, sliced, for garnish
directions: Peel and devein shrimp, then cut them into small pieces. Place the shrimp in a large bowl. Add lemon and lime juice and let the shrimp sit in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to an hour. (The shrimp should be pink on the outside and opaque on the inside.The acidity from the lemon and lime juice will “cook” the shrimp.) | Add cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, Serrano peppers, cilantro, Clamato tomato juice, and fish sauce and mix until well combined. Add salt to taste. | Cut the watermelon into a 3 inch high rectangle and use a large vegetable peeler to make thin slices. | Arrange the watermelon slices on a plate. Add shrimp ceviche and top with avocado slices. | Serve right away with tortilla chips. Shrimp ceviche can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 3 days. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 3 large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed | 1 tablespoon neutral oil | 1 yellow onion, diced | ⅔ lb ground pork | 2 teaspoons salt | 1 teaspoon curry powder | 1 tablespoon garam masala | 1 tablespoon chili powder | 1 teaspoon sugar | 1 tablespoon soy sauce | ½ tablespoon dark soy sauce | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | 1 cup mozzarella cheese, cubed | 4 large eggs, whisked | 1 cup flour | 2 cups panko breadcrumbs | 4 cups neutral oil, for frying | tonkatsu sauce, for garnish
directions: In a large pot over medium heat, boil 6 cups of water and add your russet potatoes. Boil until fully cooked, then drain. | Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute the onions until soft, then add the pork. Season the pork with salt, curry powder, garam masala, chili powder, sugar, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, and fish sauce. Fry pork until the edges start to crisp, then add it to the mashed potatoes. Mix until combined. | Heat the frying oil up in a pot over medium heat until it reaches 350ºF. | While it’s heating, shape the balls. Use your hands to mold some of the potato mixture into a pancake, then add some of the cheese in the center and mold the potato around the cheese to seal it. Repeat with the rest of the potatoes and cheese. | Set up three bowls: one with egg, one with flour, and one with panko. Dip the potato ball into the egg, then flour, then egg, then panko. | Fry the korokke until crispy and golden brown, flipping halfway through. | Drizzle with tonkatsu sauce. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: ½ tablespoon olive oil | 2 lb RumbaⓇ Flank Steak | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | ⅛ cup Wellsley FarmsⓇ Balsamic Vinegar | ⅛ cup olive oil | 1 tablespoon minced shallot | 1.5 teaspoons italian dressing | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 10 oz grape tomatoes, halved | ½ lb BarillaⓇ Penne, cooked and cooled | 1 (8-ounce) tub BelGioiosoⓇ Fresh Mozzarella Pearls | 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil | fresh basil leaf, for garnish
directions: Make the steak: Place a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and heat until shimmering. Season the RumbaⓇ Flank Steak with salt and pepper on both sides. Cook the steak in the hot oil for 8 minutes per side, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 145°F-150°F (62°C-66°C). Let the steak rest on a cutting board for 5 minutes before slicing into ½-inch cubes. Set aside. | Make the dressing. In a small bowl, add the Wellsley FarmsⓇ Balsamic Vinegar, olive oil, shallot, Italian seasoning, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until emulsified. Set aside. | Make the pasta salad: In a large bowl, combine the grape tomatoes, cooked BarillaⓇ Penne, BelGioiosoⓇ Fresh Mozzarella Pearls, and chopped basil. Add the cubed RumbaⓇ Flank Steak and dressing. Toss to combine. | Divide among 4 plates or a large serving platter and garnish with basil leaves. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container for 1-2 days. | Enjoy!

ingredients: cooking spray | 8 slices Wellsley FarmsⓇ Sliced Bacon, chopped | 10 Wellsley farmsⓡs by Nellie's Free Range Eggs | ⅓ cup Wellsley FarmsⓇ Mild Cheddar Shreds, plus more for topping | 1 cup cottage cheese | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | ½ teaspoon paprika | ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper | 3 tablespoons chopped chives
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Coat a 12-cup nonstick muffin tin with cooking spray. Set aside. | Place a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir the Wellsley FarmsⓇ Sliced Bacon in the hot skillet for about 10 minutes, or until crispy. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate and set aside. | In a blender, add the Wellsley FarmsⓇ by Nellie's Free Range Eggs, Wellsley FarmsⓇ Mild Cheddar Shreds, cottage cheese, cornstarch, salt, black pepper, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Blend for about 2 minutes, or until smooth. Pour into the prepared muffin tin, leaving ½ inch from the rim of each cup exposed. Top each with the cooked Wellsley FarmsⓇ Sliced Bacon, more Wellsley FarmsⓇ Mild Cheddar Shreds, and chives. | Bake for 15 minutes, or until completely cooked through. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Package any leftovers in a zip-top bag or airtight container for storage. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil | 2 Wellsley FarmsⓇ No Antibiotics Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts | 2 tablespoons Wellsley FarmsⓇ Taco Seasoning | 2 cups Wellsley FarmsⓇ Thai Hom Mali Jasmine Rice, cooked and warmed | 1 lime, juiced | 1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 Wellsley FarmsⓇ Hass Avocados, pitted and cubed | ½ cup Wellsley FarmsⓇ Organic Salsa | finely shredded iceberg lettuce | roma tomato, chopped | red onion, small diced | sour cream | shredded mexican cheese blend | jalapeño pepper, thinly sliced | chopped cilantro | tortilla chip, for serving
directions: Heat the olive oil in a cast iron skillet over medium heat until it shimmers. Season each Wellsley FarmsⓇ No Antibiotics Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast with 1 tablespoon Wellsley FarmsⓇ Taco Seasoning on both sides. Cook in the hot oil for 8 minutes per side, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 160°F (71°C). Transfer chicken breasts to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes before cutting into ¾-inch cubes. Keep warm and set aside. | In a medium bowl, mix together the cooked Wellsley FarmsⓇ Thai Hom Mali Jasmine Rice, lime juice, cilantro, and salt until well combined. Divide the rice mixture among 2 bowls. | In the corner of each bowl, add the cubed Wellsley FarmsⓇ No Antibiotics Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts, cubed Wellsley FarmsⓇ Hass Avocados, Wellsley FarmsⓇ Organic Salsa, iceberg lettuce, Roma tomatoes, and red onion. In the center of each bowl, add a dollop of sour cream, Mexican cheese blend, jalapeño peppers, and cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 melon small watermelon | 3 tablespoons coarse sea salt | ½ white onion, peeled and diced | 1 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled | 8 garlic cloves, minced | ½ cup gochugaru, or more if you like spice | ¼ cup fish sauce | 3 tablespoons mirin | 1 tablespoon mulyeot, (Korean corn syrup) | 1 cup fresh watermelon flesh | 1 tablespoon sesame oil, optional | 1 scallion, chopped, optional | sesame seed, optional
directions: Peel the thin green skin from the watermelon and remove the flesh. Chop the rind into bite-sized pieces. Set the flesh aside for later use. | In a large bowl, toss the rinds with sea salt and cover. Let sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the rinds to release their water. | Meanwhile, blend together 1 cup of watermelon flesh, onion, ginger, and garlic until smooth. Some small chunks are okay. | In a small mixing bowl, combine the gochugaru, fish sauce, mirin, mulyeot, and watermelon puree. | Once the rinds have released water, rinse, drain, and squeeze out the excess water. Place the rinds in a large bowl. | Pour the puree over the rinds and toss with your hands until all pieces are coated. | If desired, garnish the kimchi with sesame oil, scallion, and sesame seeds. | Enjoy immediately or store in the fridge for 3-5 days. | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? ingredients: 2 cups neutral oil, for frying | 3 slices white bread | 3 tablespoons pistachio cream, divided | 2 eggs | 1 tablespoon heavy cream | ⅔ teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk | 2 tablespoons crushed pistachios | butter, for garnish
directions: Add the 2 cups of oil to a medium pot and heat until it reaches 350ºF | Cut the crusts off the bread and smear 1 tablespoon pistachio cream on two of the slices. Layer the bread together to make sure that the pistachio cream is sandwiched inside. | In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, and vanilla. | Dip the pistachio sandwich in the egg mixture, fully coating, and fry the sandwich until golden brown, about 30 seconds per side. | Serve immediately, and garnish with condensed milk, butter, pistachio cream, and crushed pistachios. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 2 ripe mangoes, diced | 4 large ripe yellow peaches, peeled and diced | ¼ cup white sugar | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 tablespoons water | 16 lumpia wrappers | canola oil, for frying
directions: In a large non-stick pan, combine mangoes, peaches and sugar. Stir well to combine then simmer over low heat until the fruit starts to break down, about 10 minutes. | In a separate bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water until cornstarch is dissolved into a slurry. | Add the cornstarch slurry in the pan with fruit. Bring a low boil and cook until thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and let cool, about 10 minutes. | Lay two lumpia wrappers on the work surface, slightly overlapping. Scoop about 2 tablespoons of peach mango mixture into the bottom thirds of the lumpia. Fold sides in while rolling until wrapper is rolled. Wet the end of the wrapper with water and seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers. | Add about 4 inches of oil to a large heavy-bottomed pot. Heat oil to 350°F (176°C). | Working in batches, carefully place the rolls into hot oil and fry until deep golden brown, about 3-4 minutes. Place on a paper towel lined sheet to drain excess oil then repeat with remaining rolls. | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 2 lb chicken wings | 1 teaspoon smoked paprika | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon chili powder | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | ½ teaspoon ground ginger | 1.5 teaspoons chicken bouillon | ½ teaspoon salt | ½ teaspoon black pepper | 2 scallions, chopped (optional garnish) | 1 cup guava paste, cubed | ⅓ cup brown sugar | 1 tablespoon dijon mustard | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 4 tablespoons tomato paste | 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce | 1 teaspoon liquid smoke | ⅓ cup apple cider vinegar | 1 lime, juiced | salt, to taste
directions: Make sauce: In a pan add the guava paste, tomato paste, minced garlic, worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, lime juice, brown sugar, dijon mustard, water, salt and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thickened and reduced, about 12 to 15 minutes. It should have a thick consistency but still pourable to drizzle on the wings. | Preheat the airfryer to 375 degrees. Add your cleaned chicken wings to a bowl then toss with olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, dried oregano, ground ginger, chicken bouillon, salt and pepper. Mix until well combined. | Place the wings in the basket of the preheated air fryer basket. Be sure not to over crowd. Cook thewings for 20 minutes, flip wings half way through, until crispy and internal temperature reaches 165˚F (74˚C). | Toss wings in guava BBQ sauce garnish with scallions. | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: nonstick spray | 1 (13.25-ounce) package vanilla cake mix | 2 large eggs | ½ cup water | ¼ cup vegetable oil | 25 premade churroes, cut into ¾-inch pieces, divided | 1 (48-ounce) tub  TillamookⓇ Vanilla Bean Ice Cream | caramel sauce, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a 10-inch springform pan with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray. Set aside. | In a large bowl, add half of the vanilla cake mix (save the rest for another use), the eggs, water, and oil. Mix until well combined. Pour into the prepared pan. Arrange enough churros on the batter to cover the top. | Bake for 24-30 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool for 20-30 minutes, until completely cool. | Top the cooled cake with 16 scoops of TillamookⓇ Vanilla Bean Ice Cream using an 8-ounce ice cream scoop. Spread the ice cream evenly until smooth on top with a spatula. | Arrange the remaining churros on top of the ice cream in concentric circles. Wrap the pan with plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 3 hours or overnight, until firm. | Thaw the cake for 10-15 minutes before serving. Drizzle caramel sauce over the cake. | Enjoy!

recipe_name: Matcha Neapolitan Ice Cream Cake Roll
ingredients: nonstick spray | 4 large eggs, white and yolks separated | ½ cup sugar, divided | ¾ cup cake flour | 2 tablespoons matcha powder | ½ teaspoon baking powder | 3 tablespoons whole milk, warmed | 5 (8-ounce) scoops TillamookⓇ Mudslide Ice Cream | 5 (8-ounce) scoops TillamookⓇ Oregon Strawberry Ice Cream | 5 (8-ounce) scoops TillamookⓇ Vanilla Bean Ice Cream | ¾ cup white chocolate chips | ¼ cup heavy whipping cream | matcha powder, for dusting
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a half-sheet pan with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray. Set aside. | Make the cake: In a medium bowl, combine the egg yolks and ¼ cup sugar. Whisk vigorously for about 5 minutes, or until ribbons form. | In a large bowl, whip the egg whites with an electric mixer for about 6 minutes, or until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the remaining ¼ cup sugar to the egg whites and continue to whip for another 2-3 minutes. | Add about 1 cup stiff egg whites to the beaten egg yolks and whisk until well combined. Fold the egg yolk mixture into the remaining stiff egg whites until fully incorporated. | In a separate medium bowl, sift together the cake flour, matcha powder, and baking powder. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and fold until incorporated. Fold in the warmed milk until combined. | Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Be sure that the batter is completely flat and even. | Bake for 8-10 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. | Remove the pan from the oven and lay a sheet of parchment paper on top of the hot cake. Place another half-sheet pan over the parchment paper and invert the pans while wearing oven mitts. Lift the top pan, gently peel away the parchment paper from the cake, and lay a clean sheet of parchment paper over the cake. Using the backside of a baking sheet, sandwich the cake between the parchment and both baking sheets and invert once more. Remove both baking pans and the top layer of parchment. The cake should now be on the counter with a bottom sheet of parchment. | Trim ½ inch off the two short ends of the cake. Starting at one of the short ends, use your hands to slowly roll up the cake with the parchment paper and place it seam-side down. Cover the roll with a dish towel and let sit for 30 minutes. | Unroll the cake with the short ends facing left and right. Leaving a 2-inch border on each short end side, add the TillamookⓇ Mudslide Ice Cream, TillamookⓇ Oregon Strawberry Ice Cream, and TillamookⓇ Vanilla Bean Ice Cream scoops vertically down the cake with ¾-½ inch between each flavor. Spread the ice cream flat, meshing the flavors together. | Starting at the Mudslide side, roll the cake up and push down on the cake once you get to the seam. Wrap the cake in parchment paper and twist the ends of the parchment to hold its shape. Transfer to a long plate or baking sheet and freeze for at least 3 hours or overnight. | Twenty minutes before serving, make the ganache: In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips and cream. Microwave for 30-40 seconds and stir until smooth. | Unwrap the cake and place on a cutting board. Spread the ganache over the top of the cake and dust with matcha powder. Allow the ganache to set before slicing into 8 pieces. | Enjoy! | Recipe inspired by: | https://tasty.co/recipe/neapolitan-ice-cream-cake-roll

ingredients: 5 ripe mangoes | 1 pt heavy whipping cream | 1.5 teaspoons vanilla extract | 3 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk, (or more for a sweeter taste) | 1 teaspoon salt | 1 package graham crackers | fresh mint leaf, for garnish
directions: Peel mangoes and take off the cheeks. Cube 4 cheeks (2 whole mangoes) and slice the rest thinly to spin into a rose or other design. Set in the fridge to cool. | In a stand mixer or in a bowl if using an electric hand mixer (or you can whip by hand), pour in the whipping cream and vanilla extract. Whip until the cream is in stiff peaks, then fold in the condensed milk and salt. Start with a lower amount of condensed milk, then add in more until you’ve reached your desired sweetness. | In a zip top bag, crush half of the crackers and leave the rest whole. | To assemble: In a baking dish lined with parchment paper, spread a small layer of cream. This will be the glue to the crackers. Use the whole graham crackers to fill the bottom of the pan, filling in the gaps with any broken crackers. Spread more cream on top, then sprinkle over some cubed mangoes, then half of the crushed crackers. | Add another layer of cream, then add the sliced mangoes in a rose shape or however you want to decorate. | Top with the rest of the crushed crackers and refrigerate for about 5 hours until set. | Garnish with mint. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

recipe_name: This recipe is exclusively available in the Tasty app.
Brown Butter Chocolate Chip Edible Cookie Dough
ingredients: ½ cup unsalted butter, melted | 1 cup all purpose flour | ½ cup brown sugar | 3 tablespoons granulated sugar | 1 teaspoon vanilla paste | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 3 tablespoons milk, divided | ¼ cup semisweet chocolate chips | ¼ cup milk chocolate chips | flaky sea salt, for topping (optional)
directions: Brown the butter: Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Continue cooking and stirring regularly until it foams and then turns golden brown and smells nutty. Remove from heat immediately. | Heat treat the flour: Place flour in a microwave safe bowl and microwave for 2 minutes, then stir to remove any clumps. Alternatively, you can bake it. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C), spread the flour evenly on a baking sheet, and bake for 5 minutes or until the flour reaches 160°F (71°C). Let it cool completely. | In a bowl, add the browned butter, brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla paste, salt, and 2 tablespoons of milk. Use a hand mixer to beat until the mixture is fluffy, about 3 minutes. | Gradually add the heat-treated flour to the bowl, mixing until just combined. If the dough is too thick, add the remaining milk, a ½ tablespoon at a time (up to 1 tablespoon more if needed), until you reach the desired consistency. | Using a rubber spatula, fold in both the semisweet and milk chocolate chips. | Sprinkle with flaky sea salt if desired. | Store the cookie dough in the refrigerator. It will harden once chilled as the butter solidifies. Let rest at room temperature before serving. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? ingredients: 1 cup milk of choice | 2 shots espresso | 1 tablespoon syrup or sweetener of choice | ⅓ cup dark or milk chocolate | ice cube
directions: Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring in between each time until fully melted. | Pour the melted chocolate into a clear plastic cup, and coat the inside. Allow any excess to drip back into the bowl. Freeze the cup for about 10 minutes to set the chocolate. | Assemble the drink: Fill the chocolate-coated cup to the top with ice cubes. Then pour in the sweetener, followed by the milk and freshly brewed espresso. | Gently squeeze the cup to crack the chocolate mold, then give the drink a stir. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? ingredients: ½ cup small pearl tapicoa | 1.5 cups mango jelly, cut into ½ inch pieces | 2 ripe mangoes, cut into ½ inch pieces | 1.5 cups peaches, diced, skin and pit removed | ½ cup nata de coco, liquid drained | 1 (14.5oz) can coconut cream | 1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk | 1 (7.6oz) can all purpose cream
directions: In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to a rolling boil. Add tapioca pearls and stir gently to prevent the pearls from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Continue to boil for 20 minutes or until they are semi-translucent. Turn off the heat, add 2 cups of ice and let sit for about 40 minutes or until the pearls are fully translucent. When ready to use, drain and rinse under cold water. | In a large bowl, combine the cooked tapioca pearls, mango jelly, diced mango and diced peaches. Gently stir to combine. | Add the nata de coco, coconut cream, sweetened condensed milk and all purpose cream. Mix well. | Serve with ice immediately or let chill in the fridge to enjoy later. . | Enjoy! | RECIPE BY:  Abi Marquez | Busy? ingredients: 1 cup milk of choice | 1 teaspoon matcha | 1 tablespoon syrup or sweetener of choice | ⅓ cup white chocolate | ice cube
directions: Melt the white chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring in between each time until fully melted. | Pour the melted white chocolate into a clear plastic cup, and coat the inside. Allow any excess to drip back into the bowl. Freeze the cup for about 10 minutes to set the white chocolate. | Assemble the Drink: Fill the chocolate-coated cup to the top with ice cubes. Then pour in the sweetener, followed by the milk and matcha. | Gently squeeze the cup to crack the white chocolate mold, then give the drink a stir. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, diced into 1/4 inch pieces | ¾ cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese | 3 jalapeñoes, seeds removed and diced | ½ cup bacon bits | ¾ cup all-purpose flour | ¾ cup cream cheese, softened | 1 large egg | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon pepper | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | canola oil, for frying | ranch dressing, for serving
directions: Add chicken, cheddar cheese, jalapeños, bacon bits, flour, cream cheese, egg, salt, pepper and garlic powder in a large bowl. Combine until evenly mixed. | Heat a thin layer of canola oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Once the oil is hot, scoop a golf ball size amount of the mixture onto the frying pan. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until the internal temperature reaches 165˚F (74˚C). | Serve with ranch dressing or your favorite dipping sauce and enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 2 cups cooked sushi rice | 1 tablespoon rice vinegar | 1 tablespoon sugar | cooking spray | 8 oz sushi-grade tuna, diced | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1.5 teaspoons soy sauce | 1 tablespoon finely chopped green onions | 1 tablespoon Kewpie Mayo | 1 tablespoon homemade habanero hot sauce, recipe below | 8 habanada peppers, stems removed | 4 garlic cloves | ½ cup granulated sugar | ½ cup white vinegar | 4 tablespoons tomato paste | ½ cup water | 3 tablespoons fish sauce | white sesame seed | sliced avocado | sliced scallion
directions: Prepare the Homemade Habanero Sriracha: Add ingredients to blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to a small saucepan and bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes until the hot sauce has thickened. | Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Adjust the consistency with a little water if needed. Store in a jar in the fridge. | Make the Spicy Tuna: In a mixing bowl, combine the diced tuna, soy sauce, sesame oil, green onions, sriracha and Kewpie mayo. Mix well to coat the tuna evenly. Set aside in the fridge. | Make the rice: In a small bowl, mix the rice vinegar and sugar until dissolved. Add the mixture to hot, cooked sushi rice and gently fold to combine. Let it cool slightly. | Cook the Crispy Rice: Preheat your mini waffle maker and lightly coat it with cooking spray. | Take a small amount of cooled sushi rice and form it into a patty that fits the size of your waffle maker. | Place the rice patty in the waffle maker and cook until crispy and golden brown, following the waffle maker's instructions. Repeat with the remaining rice. | Assemble the Dish: Place a crispy rice waffle on a serving plate. Top each rice waffle avocado slides,  a spoonful of spicy tuna mixture and a drizzle of habanero sriracha. Garnish with scallions, toasted sesame seeds and more habanero. | Enjoy | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 white onion, thinly sliced | 3 roma tomatoes, small-diced | garlic clove, minced | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | ½ teaspoon ground cumin | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon | 4 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce | 1 tablespoon adobo sauce | 4 cups cooked and shredded chicken breast | 1 cup chicken broth | tostada, store bought or homemade | refried bean, warmed | LALAⓇ Pourable Crema | shredded iceberg lettuce | sliced avocado | crumbled queso fresco | diced tomato | Radish, thinly sliced
directions: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat until it shimmers. Sauté the onion, tomatoes, garlic, salt, oregano, cumin, and cinnamon in the hot oil. Cover and let simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender. | Transfer the tomato mixture into a blender or food processor. Add the chipotle peppers and adobo sauce; blend until smooth. | Pour the sauce back into the same skillet and add the shredded chicken and broth. Cook over medium heat for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce is darker in color and coats shredded chicken. | On a tostada, spread a layer of refried beans, LALAⓇ Pourable Crema, chicken tinga, lettuce, avocado, queso fresco, tomatoes, and radishes. Add an extra drizzle of crema. Repeat with remaining chicken tinga and tostadas. | Enjoy!

ingredients: ½ cup vegetable oil | 1 lb cooked and shredded chicken breast | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ¾ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | ½ teaspoon chili powder | ½ teaspoon ground cumin | ½ teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon garlic powder | ½ teaspoon onion powder | ½ teaspoon dried oregano | 12 corn tortillas, (8-inch) | long wooden toothpicks or cut wooden skewer | LALAⓇ Pourable Crema | shredded iceberg lettuce | crumbled queso fresco | pico de gallo | chopped fresh cilantro
directions: In a large, deep skillet, heat the oil over medium heat to 350°F (180˚C), or until shimmering. | Meanwhile, in a large bowl, toss together the chicken, salt, black pepper, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and oregano until well combined. Set aside. | Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and heat in the microwave for 30 seconds, or until soft enough to roll. | Lay a tortilla on a flat work surface and spoon some of the chicken mixture in the center. Roll up tightly, secure the seam with a toothpick, and place seam-side down on a large plate. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and chicken mixture. | Fry the flautas in the hot oil, rotating until golden brown all over. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. | Arrange the flautas on a platter and garnish with LALAⓇ Pourable Crema, lettuce, queso fresco, pico de gallo, and cilantro. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 2 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs | vegetable oil, for frying | 2 cups buttermilk | ¼ cup pickle brine | 2 tablespoons hot sauce | 2 cups all-purpose flour | 2 teaspoons salt | 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 4 tablespoons cayenne pepper | 1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar | 1 teaspoon chili powder | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon paprika | mayonnaise | burger bun | coleslaw, optional | dill pickle chip
directions: Place the chicken in a large bowl. Set aside. | Make the marinade: In a medium bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, pickle brine, and hot sauce until well combined. Pour the marinade over the chicken and stir to ensure each piece is thoroughly coated. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2-4 hours. | Prepare the breading: In another medium bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and pepper until well combined. | Working in batches, remove the chicken from the marinade and blot with paper towels; reserve the marinade in the bowl. Place the chicken in the breading and toss until evenly coated. Return the chicken to the marinade, coating all sides. Remove the chicken from the marinade, allowing the excess to drip back into the bowl. Toss the chicken again in the breading until evenly coated, then place on a wire rack. Let sit for about 15 minutes, or until the coating dries slightly. | Prepare the seasoning mix: In a small heat-safe bowl, whisk together the cayenne pepper, brown sugar, chili powder, garlic powder, and paprika. Set aside. | In a Dutch oven over high heat, add 1-2 inches oil and heat to 350˚F (180˚C). Add the chicken, 2 pieces at a time, to the hot oil. Fry for 3-4 minutes on one side, then flip and cook for 3 additional minutes on the other side, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reaches 160°F (71°C). Transfer the fried chicken to a wire rack. Repeat with the remaining chicken. | Ladle 1 cup hot oil into the seasoning mix and stir until well combined. Use a pastry brush to immediately brush the fried chicken with the seasoned oil. | Assemble the sandwiches: Spread mayonnaise over the toasted buns. Top the bottom buns with the fried chicken, coleslaw, and pickle chips. Cover with the top buns. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 3 large egg yolks | ¼ cup granulated sugar | 16 oz mascarpone cheese | ½ cup half & half | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 16 oz unsweetened Thai tea, brewed, room temperature | 32 ladyfinger cookies | cooked boba, optional for serving
directions: Fill a small saucepan halfway with water and bring to a simmer over medium heat. | In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and sugar. Add the bowl over the simmering pot of water and continually mix until sugar has fully dissolved or until the mixture is creamy and a pale yellow color, about 3 minutes. | In another bowl, use an electric hand mixer to cream together the mascarpone cheese, half and half, and vanilla extract for 2 minutes, until soft peaks form. | Add the egg yolk and sugar mixture and cream together until soft peaks form, about 2 minutes. | Add the brewed Thai tea to a shallow bowl. Working one at a time, dip the ladyfingers into the tea, holding them for 5 seconds to soak. Layer them in a 9-inch square baking dish. | Spread a layer of the mascarpone cream and repeat the layering process two more times until you finish with the mascarpone cream on top. | Cover the tiramisu with plastic wrap and chill for at least 2 hours. | Serve and top it with cooked boba pearls if desired. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? ingredients: 6 cups wood chips | 2 cups ketchup | 1 cup brown sugar | ½ cup apple cider vinegar | ¼ cup molasses | 1 tablespoon yellow mustard | 1 tablespoon kosher salt | 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub | 4 lb baby back pork rib | ½ cup McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub
directions: Make the smoke bomb: In a large disposable aluminum tray, add the wood chips. Cover the tray tightly with aluminum foil, then poke multiple holes in the top with a toothpick or fork. Set aside. | Make the sauce: In a small pot over medium heat, add the ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, molasses, mustard, McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub, salt and black pepper. Whisk to combine. Bring the sauce to a boil, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until thickened. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. | Apply the rub: On a large cutting board, pat the ribs dry with paper towels. If necessary, use a paring knife to gently loosen the membrane on the bone side of the ribs and pull it up in one sheet. Generously season the ribs on both sides with McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub. | Wrap the ribs completely in aluminum foil. | Preheat the grill to 250°F (120°C) with the lid closed. Add the smoke bomb to the grill over direct heat. Close the lid and let smoke build up for 10-15 minutes. | Place the foil-wrapped ribs on the grill over indirect heat and close the lid. Cook for about 2½-3 hours, until the meat is tender and starting to pull away from the bone. | Remove the ribs from the grill and let rest for 10 minutes. | Increase the grill temperature to high. | Unwrap the ribs. Baste one side of the ribs with the sauce and place directly on the grill, sauce-side down. Baste the other side, now facing up. | Flip the ribs and baste the other side again with the sauce. It's helpful to use 2 sets of tongs or a combination of tongs and a spatula to flip the rack. | Grill the ribs for 1-3 minutes, until the sauce caramelizes and the meat shows grill marks. | Flip the ribs again and continue grilling for 1-2 more minutes, until the sauce on the other side caramelizes. | Remove the ribs from the grill and serve with the remaining barbecue sauce. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 2 L water (2 L) | 10 peach passion tea bags | ½ cup brown sugar | ⅓ cup kosher salt | 1 tablespoon black peppercorn | 4 garlic cloves, smashed | 5 whole bay leaves | 1 lemon, sliced | 2 large ripe yellow peaches, pitted and sliced | 1 whole chicken, cut into parts | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon smoked paprika | ½ teaspoon black pepper | 1 cup peach preserve | 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter | ½ cup unsweetened peach tea | ¼ cup light brown sugar
directions: In a large pot combine water, peach tea bags, brown sugar, salt, peppercorns, garlic cloves, bay leaves, lemon slices, and peach slices. | Bring to a very light simmer over low heat and stir until the salt and sugar are dissolved. Remove from the heat, let the mixture cool down. You can add 2 cups of ice to help speed up the process. | Add the brine to the chicken pieces making sure they are fully submerged in the brine. Cover and refrigerate for at least 10 hours or overnight. | Remove the chicken from the brine. Discard the mixture and use paper towels to pat the chicken pieces dry. | In a saucepan over medium heat, add peach preserves, rice wine vinegar, butter, peach tea, and brown sugar. Stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes, or until it's reduced and the sauce is thick and sticky. | Preheat the grill to medium high heat (350ºF). | Season chicken with a drizzle of olive oil, garlic powder, smoked paprika, and black pepper. | Oil the grill grates, and place chicken on the grill. Once chicken reaches an internal temperature of 120ºF, flip so that they are skin side down. Cook until the skin has a nice char. Glaze with the sticky peach sauce. | When chicken reaches 165ºF, remove from the grill. | Serve with grilled peaches and more peach sauce. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

recipe_name: Giant Fusilli Pasta With Creamy Gochujang Sauce
ingredients: 3 servings giant Fusilli pasta, about 10 noodles | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 teaspoon chili flakes | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 3 tablespoons gochujang (Korean red pepper paste) | ¾ cup reserved pasta water | 1 cup heavy cream | ½ cup grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish | salt, to taste | fresh chive, for garnish | furikake, for garnish | spicy mayonnaise, for garnish
directions: In a large pot of boiling water, cook the giant fusilli (colonne pompeii) until al dente, about 10 minutes. Reserve 1½ cups of pasta water, then drain the pasta. | Meanwhile, in a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add chili flakes and garlic, cooking for about 2 minutes while stirring frequently. | Add the gochujang paste to the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until the paste darkens, about 3 minutes. | Add the reserved pasta water to the pan to deglaze, stirring to incorporate. Add 1 cup of heavy cream and Parmesan cheese, stirring to combine. If the sauce seems too thick, add more pasta water as needed. | Turn off the heat and add the cooked pasta to the pan, tossing to evenly coat the pasta with the sauce. | Serve the pasta with extra Parmesan on top. Garnish with fresh chives, furikake, and a drizzle of spicy mayo. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: ½ cup chopped fruit | ice | syrup or sweetener of choice, optional | 1 cup tonic water, or 1/2 cup | 2 teaspoons matcha powder | ½ cup hot water | lemon wedge, for garnish
directions: In a glass cup, add in your fruit and muddle with a large spoon or muddler. I used mangoes in one and strawberries in another. | Place some ice into your cup then follow with your sweetener of choice, if desired. I used a mogu mogu drink as the sweetener. Top with tonic water. | In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tsp matcha with ½ a cup of water until frothy, set aside. | Top your drink with matcha. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 2 lb salmon, sliced into filets | ¼ cup sake | ¼ cup mirin | 6 tablespoons white miso | 6 tablespoons sugar | fresh chive, for garnish
directions: In a small pot over medium heat, add in the sake and mirin, and let simmer for 2 minutes. | After 2 minutes, add sugar and miso. Let the mixture fully emulsify and set aside to cool, about 20 minutes. | Place your salmon into an airtight, sanitary container and add in the cooled miso mixture, making sure all of the salmon is coated. | Marinate the salmon in the refrigerator for one day, or at least 12 hours. | After marinating, place salmon on a baking sheet lined with some parchment paper and broil 6 inches away from the heat source, for about 6-10 minutes until cooked to your liking. | Serve over a bead of rice or desired grain, and garnish with chives. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? ingredients: 1 store-bought pie crust | 9.5 oz chorizo | ½ medium yellow onion, diced | 8 eggs | 8 oz shredded cheddar cheese | ½ cup spring onion, diced | 1.5 cups fresh spinach | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon garlic powder | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | sour cream, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 375º. | Press pie crust into a pie dish. Place the pie dish on a rimmed baking sheet. Fill the inside with pie weights (or line it with parchment and use dried beans if you don’t have pie weights), around ¾ full, and bake at 350˚F for about 20 minutes, or until the crust is a very light golden brown. | While the pie crust is baking, cook the sauté in a large pan on medium heat until fully cooked, around 5 minutes. Remove the chorizo from the pan and set aside. | In the same pan, add the diced onions and sauté for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. | In a large bowl, whisk 8 eggs, then add the chorizo, onion, cheese, spring onions, and spinach. Season with garlic powder, black pepper, and kosher salt. | Once the pie crust is done blind baking, pour the filling into the crust. | Bake the quiche for 40-45 minutes or until filling is just set. Let the quiche cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. Top with sour cream, if desired. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. ingredients: 1 cup cooked rice | ½ can Spam®, cubed | 1 tablespoon soy sauce | 1 tablespoon sugar | 2 tablespoons BBQ sauce | 3 eggs | spray oil, for cooking | 4 tablespoons furikake | Seaweed strip, for wrap | chive, for garnish | Kewpie Mayo, if desired
directions: Cube spam into small bites, set aside. | In a large pan on medium heat, spray with cooking oil before adding Spam. Toast on all sides until slightly brown, about 3 minutes. | Add in the soy sauce, sugar, and BBQ sauce, and cook for another 3 minutes or until the sauce thickens to liking. Remove and set aside. | In a medium bowl, mix your eggs to scramble. | In the same pan over medium heat, spray with cooking oil and scramble the eggs until set, about 1 minute. Set aside. | In a large mixing bowl, combine cooked rice with Spam, scrambled egg, and furikake. | Mix well and form into round balls. Wrap the rice balls with the seaweed strips and top with kewpie and chives. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 2 lb skirt steak | 2 tablespoons McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub | 10 Sliced pepper Jack cheeses | 1 cup diced pickled jalapeños
directions: Lay the skirt steak strips on a cutting board and cover with plastic wrap. Use a heavy skillet or food mallet to pound each strip to less than ¼-inch thickness. | Generously season the pounded steaks on both sides with McCormick® Grill Mates® Sweet & Smoky Rub. Place 5 slices pepper Jack cheese on each steak. Tightly roll up each steak lengthwise to create pinwheels. | Tie butcher twine around each pinwheel about 2 inches apart from one another. Slice each pinwheel in half lengthwise. | Preheat the grill to a two-zone high heat temperature, around 400°F (200°C). | Sear the pinwheels on the hot side of the grill for about 2 minutes per side, or until a nice crust develops. | Move the pinwheels to the cooler side of the grill and continue cooking for 8-10 more minutes, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of each pinwheel reaches 120°F (49°C). | Remove the pinwheels from the grill and let rest for 10 minutes before removing the twine and serving. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 1 pt heavy whipping cream | 1 (13.4 oz) can  ube condensed milk
directions: Whip your whipping cream using a hand or stand mixer until stiff peaks form, about 5-7 minutes. | Add in condensed milk. Use ½ the can if you like your ice cream less sweet. | Fold together the cream and condensed milk with spatula until combined, being gentle to not overmix the cream, about 2-3 minutes. | Pour mixture into an airtight container and freeze overnight. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil | 12 garlic cloves, sliced thinly | 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes | 2 tablespoons butter | 3 tablespoons tomato paste | 2 tablespoons miso | 4 cups chicken broth | 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon | ½ lb dry Pastina | ½ teaspoon fish sauce | salt and pepper, to taste | ½ cup grated parmesan cheese | chive, for garnish | parmesan cheese, for garnish | fried garlic, for garnish
directions: Cook pastina according to package directions, set aside. | In a large pan on medium heat, add in olive oil. | Add in your sliced garlic and fry for about 1 minute until fragrant. Remove about 10 slices of crispy garlic and set aside to use for garnish. | To the pan, add in the red pepper flakes and butter. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the garlic becomes golden brown. | Next, add in the tomato paste and mix well with the garlic and red pepper. Allow the tomato paste to fry for a bit to bring out more of the tomato flavor, about 1 minute. | Then mix in the miso paste to combine. Add in the chicken broth and mix together. Bring to a light simmer, for about 5-7 minutes. | Add in ½ a pound of pastina and cook for about 12 minutes or until al dente. Be sure to mix regularly to ensure the pastina does not burn on the bottom of your pot. | Once the pastina reaches desired texture, add in ½ a cup of Parmesan cheese and stir to combine. | Serve immediately with more Parmesan cheese, fried garlic chips, and chopped chives. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: ½ cup watermelon juice | ½ cup sugar | 1.5 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatins | ½ teaspoon dragon fruit powder, optional | ½ cup tequila | 1 teaspoon black sesame seeds | 15 whole limes, cut in half
directions: Carefully use a paring knife and spoon to hollow out the lime halves to remove all membranes and pith. | Juice the membranes to get ⅓ cup fresh lime juice. | In a small pot over medium heat, combine the watermelon juice and sugar; stir until the sugar dissolves. | Remove from the heat and stir in the gelatin and dragon fruit powder, if using. Stir until gelatin dissolves. Add the lime juice and tequila. Set aside. | Add lime halves to a paper-towel lined baking tray then fill each one to the top with jello mixture. Place in the refrigerator and allow them to set for at least 3 hours. | Once set, cut each lime shell into wedges and sprinkle with sesame seeds. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away.
